lifetime_events.description: 8lbs., and 12ounces.
lifetime_events.status: Born at Rose Medical Center.
additional_events: hairy
was said to have hair even on the palms of my hands, like a monkey
mom ate lots of peanut butter in her third trimester, it paid off.

lifetime_events.status: parents separate
additional_events: don't have any memories of my parents together, aside from the back and forth dropping-me-off visits they'd have in Avon, CO, or somewhere off I-70.

lifetime_events.status: going to China (Conoco) with Harry
additional_events: at one point was convinced i could fly
in retrospect, glad i never jumped off the deck.
rode a black horse named Winnie or Magic, facts TBD.

lifetime_events.status: doing barn kid things
additional_events: had a friend who had gerbils
vividly detailed memories of my grandmother Ann's old Jeffersonian house on the hill, in Snowmass
going to bed i could hear the horses below

lifetime_events.status: watching mom jump off waterfall in pink bikini
additional_events: the house we lived in had green parrots outside that would stay outside in the backyard, as outdoor pet parrots.
they were talking parrots.

lifetime_events.status: kindergarden at Mrs. Grants in Basalt, CO
lifetime_events.description: I recall during naptime, Mrs. Grant or her assistant would select a student during nap time to complete a special task for the class. When I was selected, I got to draw an outlined figure, for the class to color in. I drew a princess with puffy shoulder pads, in a polkadot dress.
additional_events: mom had boy-friend Kenichi, who taught me how to count in Japanese. He later opened a successful restaurant in Aspen

lifetime_events.status: 1st grade, sharing a bunk bed with Lakshmi
additional_events: Lakshmi and I would stay up at night and color old books, illuminated with the help of a globe light.
We'd also go to the “cookie monster’s”, aka Paradise Bakery & Cafe, of which we were reluctant to share the valued ice cream with our parents.
We'd go skiing on Buttermilk with the WeeSki
dad moved to Houston for his first stint in Texas

lifetime_events.status: 2nd grade, the uniform year
additional_events: Moved in with Dad for a few months in Orlando, where I attended a Catholic school
Wore a uniform with green, red, blue and yellow.
my dad would flip me back and upside-down behind the couch to get my hair in a perfect pony tail.
went to Disneyland once but it rained and the amusement park closed
moved to Honduras where my mom taught scooba-diving with a man named Phil Weir
was considered the only gringo kid on the island, and I didn't have an appetite to learn Spanish, unfortunately.
My uniform in Roatán was marroon and it had a crusted embroidery in the top left pocket.
I bought one of my favorite purses of all time, a colorfully and hand-sewn/together shoulder pouch.

lifetime_events.status: 3rd Grade, the Waldorf School.
lifetime_events.description: There was a tie-die dress I wore, and loved it, when we went one time to the bay for some rollerblading.
additional_events: moved to San Diego as my mom met Phil Merril, of whom became a semi-influential figure in my life from 8-13, in their semi-long term relationship.
Learned to knit and crochet at school.
Was really into Michael Jackson.
Our home  had a spiral staircase that led to a home office.
Dad moved back to Denver (he worked for Continental and they had him relocate a few times).
Dad then lived in Albequerque for a stint, where I visited him and the place had dark pink carpet

lifetime_events.location: San Diego, CA, USA / Crested Butte, CO, USA
lifetime_events.status: 4th Grade, move back to the mountains.
lifetime_events.description: Took class with Nancy Vogel and I still remember most the girls in my grade: Kasey Bailey Whitney Lauren Lulu Rita Lauren Jessica
additional_events: honestly felt like I owned the town of Crested Butte.
was really into TLC, Seal, and MTV
began to chat in AOL chatrooms, chatrooms that is, of all natures.
did a kickass report on Gnomes
switched to snowboarding
one time skipped school to go hang out at Peanut Lake
Dad moved to Houston, TX, where I spent some time with him. We lived in a pink house with a magnificent tree I loved to sit in, in the front yard.
Spent time at the YMCA.
I remember cockroaches in Houston.

lifetime_events.location: Crested Butte, CO, USA / St. Helena, CA, USA
lifetime_events.status: 5th grade, back to California to live in a haunted house.
lifetime_events.description: Favorite movie: Harriet the Spy. The house we lived in was separated into 5 houses, and allegedly a man shot himself there before we moved in.
additional_events: Spent a lot of time wondering the perimeters, climbing the roof, spying on Phil.
considered living in the guest house but it was small, creepy, unkept and far from the main house
at school, my fondest memory was carving a gourd with a sharp, heated metal tip.
got really into Track & Field, and PE was a big deal at my school. Ended up running my fastest mile there, at 7.51minutes
had a good friend named Pat who had an awesome tree house. He was a couple years older but we were just friends.
trips to Mexico including San Miguel de Allende, and trips to Lake Powell.

lifetime_events.status: 6th grade, moved out of haunted house and into a town home with viniard in backyard
lifetime_events.description: Took a class from the same voice actor as the Little Ceasar's character that says 'Pizza Pizza'
additional_events: Played Ophelia in 'Something's Rotten in the State of Denmark'
switched schools and went to a school in Calistoga for a few months.

Lived next door to some Brits, who we went to a trip to the Baja California Peninsula where we got to go on a tiny cigar boat and see a momma whale and a baby whale, of which someone on the boad pet, not sure it was me or someone else.
back at home, hung out on roof most days.

lifetime_events.location: Cave Cree, AZ, USA / Care Free, AZ, USA
lifetime_events.status: 7th grade, Terravita gated community.
lifetime_events.description: Both houses had a pool. In the 2nd house I was privileged and my mom let me live in the guest house.
additional_events: the closet in the guest house had a hidden hiding area in the closet, uneasy to be seen unless you knew about it.
was admittedly really into NSYNC
good friends included Irena Lisa Lindsey Ashley Jessica, some of which we'd obsessively exchange notes with each other.
had a really good math teach that taught me things I still use today, like the “is/of” technique for percentages.
frequent trips to Lake Powell, we had a cigar boat there, the “Karin Ann”
learning to water ski
Dad married Molli, an extremely influential and loving step-mom (current) I get to have. With it came my wonderful sisters Kati and Lyndsi.

lifetime_events.status: 8th grade, back to the mountains.
lifetime_events.description: Was excited to be back in a small town and wear Birkenstocks
additional_events: We had Ski PE during winter on thursdays/fridays
Saw Tuck & Patti perform live at the middle/high school.
Performed in the 8th grade play, “School House Rock” where i kind of fibbed my song the 2nd of 3 nights, for ‘The Great American Melting Pot’ (I got nervous).
Dad and Molli came for the play and announced they were pregnant with brother Mitch.

lifetime_events.status: Freshmen Year, move in with Dad, Molli, Kati, and Lyndsi.
lifetime_events.description: Enroll at Heritage High School. Want to go to same school for 4 consecutive years. Mom was considering going to San Miguel de Allende and I decided to live with dad for high school. Was pleased with the wonderful people I had met along the way but was ready to sink my toes into an environment.
additional_events: very few number of friends freshmen year
volunteered during lunch break in school library, eating french fries and ranch in the back room alone
Mitchell is born
the cafeteria in High School was the most terrifying place I'd experienced. I was used to 10-20 students per class, HHS had 400-500 students in our class which was considered huge for me at the time.

lifetime_events.status: Freshmen/Sophomore Year, start working.
lifetime_events.description: Get my first job at Paradise Bakery & Cafe, at the old South Glenn Mall.
additional_events: Also worked at Sears Roebuck & Co. in the Home Fashions department

lifetime_events.status: Sophomore/Junior Year, hostess and sometimes waitress.
lifetime_events.description: Working at Beau Jo's Pizza in Highlands Ranch
additional_events: Started making more friends, including Kristin Katie Stephanie Katie and more.

lifetime_events.status: Junior/Senior Year, and Wet Seal at Park Meadows Mall
lifetime_events.description: Started working there to buy cute and inexpensive clothes.
additional_events: Asked to prom by the senior lacrosse team captain

lifetime_events.status: Senior Year, getting ready for college.
lifetime_events.description: Did the Senior Prom Fashion Show
additional_events: Working at Pasta Jay's

lifetime_events.status: Freshmen Year, living in Farrand Hall at CU - Boulder
lifetime_events.description: Rather excited to be an adult.
additional_events: Major is Psych
Go to Cancun with best friend Katie Sturges.
Add Art to Major.
Working at Zolo Bar & Grill

lifetime_events.status: Freshmen/Sophomore Year, first apartment with Lauren, Jessica, and Katie in the Goss House
additional_events: Switch Psych to Journalism: Media Studies
Travel to Italy with best friend Roberta Baines.

lifetime_events.status: Work at The Tavern in DTC for summer. Move into studio apartment in fall.
Junior/Senior Year, get really into photography.
lifetime_events.description: Lived with a couple guys for a few months off Craigslist, moved in with Maya Weinstein for a few months, found Kate Whiteneck as a roommate.
additional_events: Zolo Bar & Grill
Folsom St. Coffee Co.

lifetime_events.status: Senior, working at Folsom St. Coffee Co.
lifetime_events.description: Start taking classes at ATLAS Institute.
additional_events: Accepted into BFA Program
14th Street. Bar & Grill
Radda Trattoria

lifetime_events.status: Super Senior Year, working at Folsom St. Coffee Co and Ideal Market.
lifetime_events.description: Live in house off Folsom with Denise, Kim, Jeremy. Take Fall semester off.

lifetime_events.status: Super + Duper Senior Year, graduate CU.
lifetime_events.description: Complete BFA for Integrated Arts, and Capstone Project for ATLAS in same final semester.
additional_events: Build a 'Post-Human' sculpture named Rose.
Get first non-service job at Microsoft as Image Specialist on Bing Maps.

lifetime_events.status: First year volunteering with CommuniKey
lifetime_events.description: Gemini in summer, start to love the techno beats.
additional_events: Leave Microsoft to work at BDW as Academic Operations Manager

lifetime_events.status: Volunteer at Scrib to learn about freelancing.
lifetime_events.description: Internship to become a web developer.
additional_events: Get summer Internship in the Interactive Development department, for minimum wage, at Crispin Porter + Bogusky
Build Via Foci as current brand to replace brittanyansay.com

lifetime_events.status: Get job in Denver as junior developer.
lifetime_events.description: Work in Rhino District at SpireMedia as frontend dev.

lifetime_events.status: Start at Vermilion as full-stack developer.
lifetime_events.description: becoming Senior in Frontend, more comfortable with backend
additional_events: Start teaching at Front Range Community College, once a week: Spring class is called 'Complete Web Authoring', Fall class is called 'Web Architecture: Open Source'
